intro: Melhania linearifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf melhania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Melhania linearifolia is often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers or in forest understories.
